contentrichtext.text: {{Korean name|Yoo}} {{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[Tennis]]}} {{MedalCountry|{{KOR}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Asian Games]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1986 Asian Games|1986 Seoul]]|Singles}} {{MedalGold|[[1986 Asian Games|1986 Seoul]]|Doubles}} {{MedalGold|[[1986 Asian Games|1986 Seoul]]|Mixed doubles}} {{MedalGold|[[1986 Asian Games|1986 Seoul]]|Team}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Yoo Jin-Sun''' (born July 12, 1962 in [[Seocheon]], [[Chungcheongnam-do]]) is a former [[tennis player]] from [[South Korea]], who represented his native country as a qualifier at the [[1988 Summer Olympics]] in [[Seoul]]. There he was defeated in the first round by the number twelve seed from [[Israel]], [[Amos Mansdorf]]. The right-hander reached his highest singles [[Association of Tennis Professionals|ATP]]-ranking on June 13, 1988, when he became the number 194 of the world. ==External links== *[http://www.atptennis.com/en/players/playerprofiles/default2.asp?playernumber=Y010 Profile at ATP-site] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Yoo, Jin-Sun | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Tennis player | DATE OF BIRTH = July 12, 1962 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yoo, Jin-Sun}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:South Korean male tennis players]] [[Category:Tennis players at the 1988 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic tennis players of South Korea]] [[Category:Asian Games medalists in tennis]] {{SouthKorea-tennis-bio-stub}}
